description: Goal: Integrate Bugsnag into our video client to capture errors and automatically include environment context and user metadata for easier debugging. #### Requirements 1. Install & Configure Bugsnag - Add Bugsnag dependency to the video client. - Initialize Bugsnag with the correct project API key (configured from k8s-deploy/config.js). - Wrap the root React application with the Bugsnag error boundary. 2. Environment Detection - Ensure Bugsnag events include the correct environment name: - local (running locally on dev machines) - development (shared dev environment) - staging - production - Use existing environment variables/configuration to set this value dynamically. 3. User Metadata - Attach user context to every Bugsnag event: - Person ID â€” string or UUID identifying the logged-in user. - Account ID â€” identifier for the userâ€™s account/organization. - Ensure this is updated on login/logout. 4. Testing - Simulate an error (e.g., throw inside a component) and verify in the Bugsnag dashboard that: - The correct environment is reflected. - Person ID and Account ID are reported. https://docs.bugsnag.com/platforms/javascript/react/ https://app.bugsnag.com/broadvoice-3/video-client/overview

summary: Empty state for new chats via search bar
description: ## User story As a user, I want to see a clean view when I start a conversation through the search bar, so that I can have a less cluttered interface. ## Context We currently have two methods for starting conversations: one using the search bar and another using a newly added button (https://broadvoice-jira.atlassian.net/browse/CUU2-2776 + https://broadvoice-jira.atlassian.net/browse/CUU2-2895). When starting a conversation through the search bar, if no existing conversation with the selected contact is found, the contact's avatar, name, and phone number are displayed in the main conversation area, positioned above the message input field and send button. However, when creating group conversations with multiple participants, this results in a cluttered view, showcasing one avatar, name, and phone number for each user, which can be visually overwhelming and confusing, as shown in the following image. To enhance the user experience, we aim to synchronize both conversation creation methods, ensuring that the visual presentation and overall experience are cohesive. Implementing an empty state similar to the one used in the new conversation creation method, accessible via the dedicated button for conversations initiated through the search bar, will allow us to remove redundant contact details, such as avatars, names and phone numbers, from the conversation view. This change will result in a cleaner, more consistent, and easier-to-read interface, especially for group conversations. ## Acceptance criteria As is currently | As it should be :check_mark: Functional requirements FR1. Start a new conversation from the header - The user selects one or more contacts in the header's search - If thereâ€™s no existing conversation with the selected contact(s), a placeholder image and text are displayed - The conversation header is also displayed when creating a new conversation with a single contact (not in ad-hoc groups) - By sending a message or choosing to create a named group (through the modal), the conversation becomes effective, and the placeholder is replaced by the conversation body FR2. Existing conversation when adding people in the header - The user selects one or more contact in the header's search - If a prior conversation exists, it should be loaded in the main conversation area - If by adding or removing contacts, the conversation is considered new again, the placeholder mentioned in FR1 should be displayed FR3. Existing behavior to keep - Ad-hoc groups can only be created as external-only or internal-only - After selecting an external contact, internal contacts appear disabled - After selecting an internal contact, external contacts and unsaved numbers appear disabled - When more than 1 internal contact is added, the existing buttons to video call (if allowed) or create a named group should be displayed in the headerâ€™s search bar - If only 1 internal contact is selected, a button to start a voice call is also displayed ðŸ› ï¸ Non-functional requirements NFR1. Layout - The position of the placeholder (combination of image and text) is relative to the chat footer with a distance of about 20% the chat areaâ€™s height - Note: This position is to be assessed and better defined during development through design follow-ups Assets: https://xd.adobe.com/view/4ba02f1a-8720-4278-ae02-32936d9a4767-1ef3/ ## Other information N/A

summary: Display sending status for internal conversations
description: ## User story As a user, I want to see the sending status when I send an internal conversation message, so that I can confirm if the message was successfully sent. ## Context Users do not currently receive immediate feedback on the status of sent messages in internal conversations, including both 1:1 and group conversations. The absence of visual indicators can cause frustration during message failures or delays. A similar feature exists for SMS. This proposal suggests implementing visual indicators for sent messages and offering users the option to resend messages if they fail. ## Acceptance criteria :check_mark: Functional requirements The following requirements apply only to conversations with directory (internal) contacts, either groups or 1:1. FR1. Sending an internal message - As the user hits send on an internal message, immediately display the new message bubble with the status â€œSendingâ€ - The message input should be cleared - The status â€œSendingâ€ will prevail until we can guarantee that it was successfully sent, or it returns an error - While in the â€œSendingâ€ status, the user canâ€™t long-tap to access more options FR2. Successfully sent internal message - Upon confirmation that the message was sent, the â€œSendingâ€ status is replaced with the status â€œSentâ€ - The â€œSentâ€ status is only displayed in the latest message successfully sent by the user - Itâ€™s now possible to long-tap on a message to access all existing options FR3. Internal message fails to be sent - If the message fails to be sent, the â€œSendingâ€ status is replaced with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status, along with the retry option - This â€œFailed to sendâ€ status remains attached to each message that failed to be sent by the user - The user can delete or copy a message with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status - The options to reply or pin shouldnâ€™t be displayed on a message with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status - If the latest message in a conversation is the one that failed, the message â€œMessage failed to sendâ€ should be displayed as the preview of that conversation on the messages list FR4. Retry sending the message on fail - When the message is in the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status, a retry button is displayed along with it (â€œTap to retryâ€) - When the user taps on this retry option: - The message returns to the bottom of the chat (position of the latest sent message) - The message now displays the â€œSendingâ€ status, and bears the same limitations as on FR1 - The timestamp updates to correspond with the new attempt - Will follow the success or fail scenarios described in FR2 and FR3 :tools: Non-functional requirements NFR1. Usability and Interface - Each message status bears a different icon, according to the assets provided - Message statuses are displayed under the sent message bubble, aligned to the right of the bubbleâ€™s body (excluding the tip affordance) NFR2. Performance - Message status updates as soon as we can get confirmation of its success or failure - The retry flow (getting the message back to the bottom of the chat with the sending status), should occur no later than 300ms after the user taps on the retry option. NFR3. Success measure - Save an event on Google Analytics with the name: â€œim_message_failed_retryâ€ to count the number of times users tap on the inline error and retry to send. Assets: https://xd.adobe.com/view/055b9887-12de-4215-8d16-59a7c9ac53fb-5008/ ## Other information N/A

summary: Implement optimistic message sending with status display in internal chats
description: ## User story As a user, when I send a message in an internal chat, I want to see its status immediately so that I understand whether it was sent successfully and experience a more responsive interface. ## Context Messages currently appear in the conversation only after receiving confirmation from the Messaging API. This can lead to delays, particularly on slow connections, making the system feel unresponsive. Additionally, users often have to retype their messages if they fail to send, which can result in frustration. To enhance user experience, we plan to introduce optimistic message sending on our web/ desktop platform. When a message is sent in an internal conversation (including both 1:1 chats and group conversations) it will be displayed instantly in the conversation with a temporary sending state. This state will then be updated to either a sent state or a failed state (with an option to retry), depending on the response received from the backend. ## Acceptance criteria :check_mark: Functional requirements The following requirements apply only to conversations with directory (internal) contacts, either groups or 1:1. Deleted messages doesnâ€™t show status. FR1. Sending an internal message - As the user hits send on an internal message, immediately display the new message bubble with the status â€œSendingâ€ - The send message button should no longer display a loading status when a message is being sent (both internal or SMS) - The status â€œSendingâ€ will prevail until we can guarantee that it was successfully sent, or it returns an error - While in the â€œSendingâ€ status, the more options button (3-dots) shouldnâ€™t be displayed FR2. Successfully sent internal message - Upon confirmation that it was sent, the â€œSendingâ€ status is replaced with the status â€œSentâ€ - The â€œSentâ€ status is only displayed in the latest message successfully sent by the user - The more options button (3-dots) is now displayed when hovering over the message FR3. Internal message fails to be sent - If the message fails to be sent, the â€œSendingâ€ status is replaced with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status, along with the retry option - This â€œFailed to sendâ€ status remains attached to each message that failed to be sent by the user - The user can delete a message with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status - The options to reply, edit, or pin shouldnâ€™t be displayed on the options of a message with the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status FR4. Retry sending the message on fail - When the message is in the â€œFailed to sendâ€ status, a retry button is displayed along with it (â€œClick to retryâ€) - When the user taps on this retry option: - The message returns to the bottom of the chat (position of the latest sent message) - The message now displays the â€œSendingâ€ status, and bears the same limitations as on FR1 - The timestamp updates to correspond with the new attempt - Will follow the success or failure scenarios described in FR2 and FR3 :tools: Non-functional requirements NFR1. Usability and Interface - Each message status bears a different icon, according to the assets provided - Message statuses are displayed under the sent message bubble, aligned to the right of the bubbleâ€™s body (excluding the tip affordance) NFR2. Performance - Message status updates as soon as we can get confirmation of its success or failure - The retry flow (getting the message back to the bottom of the chat with the sending status), should occur no later than 300ms after the user taps on the retry option. NFR3. Success measure - Save an event on Google Analytics with the name: â€œim_message_failed_retryâ€ to count the number of times users tap on the inline error and retry to send. Assets: https://xd.adobe.com/view/da71aee6-211e-4a88-8e62-065579503674-8f22/ ## Other information N/A

Currently, our polling mechanism attempts to poll the same number of conversations that are currently loaded. This becomes problematic when users have more than 100 conversations loaded: - It increases unnecessary network load. - It doesnâ€™t provide additional value since we only care about the latest changes, and the polling request is ordered by latest message. - Messaging API/Scylla will throw when fetching more the 100 conversations at once. To optimize polling, we should restrict the limit to 30 conversations, which aligns with the default load behavior. Acceptance Criteria: - Conversation polling should always use 30 as the limit, regardless of how many are currently loaded. Testing Considerations: - Load fewer than 30 conversations and verify polling handles them correctly. - Load more than 30 (e.g., 100+) and confirm only 30 are polled. - Confirm that polling results still reflect the most recent conversation updates.

summary: Adjust incoming call notification when the user is on a call
description: ## User story As a user on an active call, I want a brief, non-intrusive audio alert for incoming calls, so that I can be notified without disrupting my conversation. ## Context Users currently experience a poor notification experience during active calls due to competing audio sources. The standard continuous ringtone disrupts ongoing conversations. The goal is to enhance the incoming call notification for users already on a call. ## Acceptance criteria - When a user is on an "On call" state (audio or video call) and receives a new audio call: - The incoming call should play the provided audio instead of the standard ringtone. - While ringing, the audio will play in 10-second intervals, until it is answered, declined, or the caller hangs up (e.g. audio plays once, wait 10 seconds, then play again. This pattern is repeated until the call stops ringing). - The user should receive a visual notification of the incoming call (UI popup remains unchanged). - When a user is not in an â€œOn callâ€, or â€œDo not disturbâ€ state, the incoming call should use the standard continuous ringtone. - This behavior should remain consistent across desktop and web platforms. summary: Implement reactive internal and external contact update handling
description: ## User story As a user, I want the updates to be reflected in real-time when I edit or delete a contact, so that I have the most current information. ## Context Currently, updates to both internal and external contacts in the B-Hive Portal are not reflected in real-time across the app. Users must manually refresh or navigate to see updates. The backend will be updated to send real-time events when internal contacts are modified and deleted, allowing the frontend to receive updated information immediately. ## Acceptance criteria When a contact is edited, the updates should be immediately reflected, historically and going forward throughout the app, in the following interactions: - Internal contact - Conversation list (recent and unread) - 1:1 conversations (header, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - Named group conversation (members list, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - New conversation creation (in the unnamed section) - Call history (recent and missed) - Softphone interface (receiving and making calls, including adding or transferring calls) - Video call history - New video call creation - Voicemail list (unread and all) - Voicemail forward contact list - Contacts list (favorites and contacts, in the unnamed section) - Message notifications (in-app and push) - App call notifications - System call notifications - External contact - Conversation list (recent and unread) - 1:1 conversations (header, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - Ad-hoc group conversation (header, members list, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - New conversation creation (in the â€œContactsâ€ section) - Call history (recent and missed) - Softphone interface (receiving and making calls, including adding or transferring calls) - Voicemail list (unread and all) - Contacts list (favorites and contacts, in the â€œContactsâ€ section) - Message notifications (in-app and push) - App call notifications - System call notifications When a contact is deleted, the updates should be immediately reflected, historically and going forward throughout the app, in the following interactions: - Internal contact - Conversation list (recent and unread) - 1:1 conversations (header, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - Named group conversation (messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - External contact - Conversation list (recent and unread) - 1:1 conversations (header, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - Ad-hoc group conversation (header, members list, messages bubble, system messages, mentions) - Call history (recent and missed) - Voicemail list (unread and all) There is an issue reported by a client regarding voicemail sender names. When all users share the same CLID on their SIP accounts, the voicemail displays the name of the first user alphabetically in the location. Since the voicemail system does not have a personId in the endpoints, Android has always relied on the phone number for matching.At the moment, we are simply displaying the information provided by the backend without performing any additional matching. We have already created an investigation ticket to look into the current logic for displaying sender names across all platforms and to determine what changes are needed to correctly display the sender name in voicemails. ## Other information Users are able to easily locate new or existing contacts, through the following options: - Internal contacts - Messages tab (creating a new conversation or adding members to a named group conversation) - Calls tab - On call (transferring or adding calls) - Video tab (creating a new meeting, in the invite users section) - Contacts tab (in via search or scrolling to the contact by name, in the unnamed section) - Voicemail tab - External contacts - Messages tab (creating a 1:1 conversation) - Calls tab - Voicemail tab - Contacts tab (via search or scrolling to the contact by name, in the "My contacts" section)

Introduce user-selectable noise cancellation in the web video app using Twilioâ€™s Krisp integration. This should reduce background noise for participants without degrading voice quality, and be configurable per user. ### Goals - Provide a toggle/control for noise cancellation in the web client. - Apply Krisp noise suppression during live calls when enabled. - Ensure default behavior aligns with product decision (e.g., on by default unless specified). - Persist user preference within the browser; ### Functional requirements As is today | Introduced in this story FR1. Enable noise cancellation - To the current â€œAudio settingsâ€ a new switch is added â€œSuppress background noiseâ€, under the microphone settings - This option is on by default - This option is available both on the lobby screen and the ongoing meeting - On unsupported browsers (e.g., Safari/iOS), this option is not be displayed - The noise cancellation preference persists per user across sessions on the same browser FR2. Modal layout updates (lobby and meeting) - The order of the Speakers and Microphone settings has changed - Update the title of this modal to â€œAudio & video settingsâ€ Assets: https://www.figma.com/design/jV2kDALAEEkMvfVty5AUKs/Noise-cancellation-setting?node-id=5-69 ### Expected Outcome - Participants experience noticeably reduced background noise on web. - No significant degradation in voice clarity or latency. - Clear UI affordance indicating current noise cancellation status. ### Acceptance Criteria - Users can enable/disable noise cancellation in-call on supported browsers. - On unsupported browsers (e.g., Safari/iOS), the settings should not display the noise cancellation option. - Setting takes effect without requiring the user to rejoin the call. - Noise cancellation preference should persist per user across sessions on the same browser. - No regression in call setup success rate (test multiple browsers, including Safari), CPU usage within acceptable thresholds for typical hardware, and no significant added latency. - Analytics/telemetry records when noise cancellation is enabled/disabled (Google analytics). https://www.twilio.com/docs/video/noise-cancellation

summary: [Messaging API] Cap conversations limit fetch to 100
description: Currently, when the backend receives a request for more than 100 conversations, ScyllaDB throws an error. While the controller currently rejects requests with a limit higher than 300, this threshold is too high. We want to introduce a cap at 100 conversations: - If a request asks for >100 conversations, the backend should automatically cap it to 100 instead of throwing an error or rejecting. - This ensures backward compatibility, since we donâ€™t want to set the limit constraint on the endpoint directly (to avoid breaking legacy clients). ### Acceptance Criteria - Any request with limit > 100 is automatically reduced to 100. - Requests with limit <= 100 continue to behave normally. - Requests with no limit parameter keep the current default behavior. - ScyllaDB query should never try fetching more than 100 conversations. ### Technical Notes - Implement logic in the controller/service layer to cap limit at 100 before making the DB call. - Do not return an error for limits over 100, apply the cap silently. - Update logging to indicate when capping is applied (optional debug logging). ### Testing Considerations - Fetch with limit = 50 â†’ returns up to 50. - Fetch with limit = 100 â†’ returns up to 100. - Fetch with limit = 200 â†’ returns up to 100 (no error). - Fetch with limit = 1000 â†’ returns up to 100 (no error). - Confirm no Scylla errors are thrown at high request limits. Request example: https://app.broadvoice.com/api/messaging/conversations?sortField=LastMessage&Include=LastMessage&IncludeRemoved=true&Limit=120&ShowCallMessagesInChat=true Error log in prod https://o11y.broadvoice.io/goto/c4jxGW3Hg?orgId=1 Note: The error is not reproducible in labs due to different scylladb restrictions.

For example, when the conversation is archived and a user is added or removed from the group by another user who still has the conversation active, the group conversation reopens for users who have already archived the conversation.
